page.title: 09STIBBINGTON'S FORMER SCHOOL
page.content: Stibbington's village school, which was opened in 1872 was closed in 1981 due to falling numbers. The village children now have to travel to school in Elton, eight kilometers away. Most villagers disagreed with the school closure and would like to see the school re-opened. One resident though expressed a positive view that "perhaps a wider and broader education was available at Elton", a much larger school. Presently the old school building is used as part of the Stibbington Field Study Centre. It functions as the day visitors' centre and is maintained in the style of a 19th century classroom in order to allow visiting students to sample school life in Victorian times.
